comment._content:
Bolt Edward Miller born   Camberwell  4th qr 1893
Bolt Edward M died age 45 Camberwell 4th qr 1937
Bolt Edward M died age 67 Essex S.W. 2nd qr 1963 birth not found
Bolt Edgar Mace born Portsea 3rd qr 1899
Bolt  Edgar M died age 66 Gosport 2nd qr 1966

comment._content: This would seem to be our man: Medal card of Bolt, Edgar Mace Corps Rank Royal Garrison Artillery Second Lieutenant discovery.nationalarchives.gov.uk/SearchUI/Details?uri=D1... Bolt Edgar Mace born Portsea 3rd qr 1899 Bolt Edgar M died age 66 Gosport 2nd qr 1966 FreeBMD

comment.author: 13706945@N00
comment._content: And from the London Gazette, 24 January 1918: “War Office, 24th. January, 1918. REGULAR FORCES. The undermentioned Gentlemen Cadets from the R. Mil. Acad., to be 2nd Lts. 25th Jan. 1918: -- […] R.G.A. -- […] Edgar Mace Bolt.” www.london-gazette.co.uk/issues/30491/supplements/1180/

comment.author: 13706945@N00
comment._content: From the Half-Yearly Army List, January 1941 (from the Gradation List of Officers of the British Army), p. 395: BOLT, Edgar Mace, (g*), y*. Born 19/6/99. R.A. 2-Lt. 25/1/18. Lt. 25/7/19. Capt. 25/1/31. Adjt. 16/2/33 to 18/12/34. Maj. 1/8/33. Asst. Supt. (Class EE to 31/7/38.) Exptl. Estabt. Shoeburyness 21/2/37 to 4/11/38 1914-21. France & Belgium 21/8/18 to 11/11/18. Wounded. B.W.M. V.M. Via the National Library of Scotland: digital.nls.uk/british-military-lists/pageturner.cfm?id=8...

comment.author: 13706945@N00
43688219@N00
comment._content:
The 1 year old Edgar M, born Portsea, Hampshire, was recorded on the 1901 census at 132 Queens Road, Portsmouth. This was the household of his parents, Alfred J, (aged 33 and a Butchers Shop Keeper from Portsea) and Maria L, (aged 36 and from Melcombe Regis, Weymouth). Their other child is:-
Alfred J..............aged 4.........born Portsea
Also in the household is Edgars aunt, Rhoda C Bolt, (aged 26, single and a Drapers assistant from Portsea).

By the time of the 1911 census the 11 year old Edgar Mace Bolt and his family have moved to 10 Kingston Road, Buckland, Portsmouth. His parents Alfred James and Maria Louisa have been married 15 years  and have had two children, both then still alive. Edgard Mace and his brother Alfred James are still at school.
